summary:
The Arc de Triomphe is a famous monument in Paris, France, located at the end of the Champs-Élysées. It was built to honor soldiers who fought in the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars. The names of victories and generals are written on it. Underneath, there is a tomb for an unknown soldier from World War I.

Designed by Jean Chalgrin, the arch is inspired by ancient Roman architecture. It is 164 feet tall and 148 feet wide, making it the tallest triumphal arch until 1938. Similar arches in Mexico City and Pyongyang are now taller.
title: Arc de Triomphe
